comment: Extremely passionate about the subject matter and regularly tries his best to involve students in the discussion. Few projects (which require a fair bit of effort) and the mid-term and the final ended up being the only real grades in the class. Paying attention and reading through the power points (and/or skimming the book) will land a B for sure.

The professor is very unclear. The final project's requirements were changed without informing students. We had to ask many times of what we were required. The final grade is heavily dependent on tests which are mostly short answer. Midterm is 30%, so is the final. The projects do not count for a lot, which is what you mostly do in the class.

The teacher is very unclear. We had one final project in the class, and the requirements were changed without informing the students. We had to ask, and then we were informed. The tests are on the concepts of testing, and mostly short answer questions. Grade is heavily dependent on tests, the project did not count as a lot. Final 30%, Midterm 30%.

The book was awful. Worst multiple choice tests ever. 'a','b','c', then 'd' is 'a and b'. 'e' is 'a and c', f is 'none of the above' the short answer questions can be ambiguous. you can argue questions with him in his office and if you can justify your answer he will give you credit. I don't feel I learned anything in this class.

Just do the journals weekly according to his standards, complete the Group Work quickly and nicely and bring the book to the final and midterm (just use the index for those) and you will likely walk out of the class with an A.

I am very glad that I took this professor. His classes were great, yes they can be challenging but we are in college. The most positive thing I took from him, is that he is approachable. He gave me GREAT advice that I used to my advantage which later helped me get an internship. Take him and you won't regret it.I am now taking him for SWE 3613

Very nice and helpful professor. Lectures were very clear and easy to understand for the most part. Some assignments are a little confusing and the project was a lot of work, but tests are quite easy. Definitely recommend.

This teacher uses presentation notes, but also expects you to take some book notes and listen to discussions as well, so be prepared. However, this is imbalanced to his tests, which are very short (roughly 10-15 questions) and use short answers. He is very helpful and clear, just somewhat monotone and easy to get distracted!

I had this professor for and ethics course required for software engineering majors, and I have him for intro to software engineering this semester. He is very knowledgeable and encourages class discussion.

He is Great! He simply cares about the students & wants the best for thm. Lots of interesting real world stories & scenarios for studs to learn from. Understanding, as long as you keep him informed. Testes are off his power points. Easy to get an A if you follow his instruc. I took Capstone with him

Good professor, really knows his stuff.  He is an expert in his field (software engineering) and gives very clear lectures.  If you review for his tests you will get a good grade on them.  The book is only used for homework, rely on his lecture slides for studying.
